headline.main: If You Gave Mickey Mouse $400-Million, Here's How He'd Spend It; Walt Disney World Is a Three-Dimensional Cartoon That Includes the Spectator Within the Cartoon

results.snippet: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla. -- My first glimpse of Walt Disney World -the gigantic city of fun that opened its gates to the public here last weekend -- was of the delicate spires and turrets of a fanciful medieval castle reaching over the treetops a...
results.lead_paragraph: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla. -- My first glimpse of Walt Disney World -the gigantic city of fun that opened its gates to the public here last weekend -- was of the delicate spires and turrets of a fanciful medieval castle reaching over the treetops a couple of miles away like beckoning fingers.

results.abstract: MIT scientists and engineers rept radio wave experiment is planned during US Apollo 17 mission to search for water below lunar surface; Space Research Center official R H Baker says probe will detect water if it is no more than 6 mi deep; planned experiment described; Raytheon Corp is building equipment; scientists consider Aristarchus crater, likely landing site, promising place for water search

headline.main: An Apollo 17 Experiment Will Seek Water on Moon

results.snippet: A radio-wave experiment is planned for Apollo 17 to search for the water that some scientists now believe may lie beneath the moon's surface.
results.lead_paragraph: A radio-wave experiment is planned for Apollo 17 to search for the water that some scientists now believe may lie beneath the moon's surface.

headline.main: Thant Is Firm on Stepping Down

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: FAR EAST, SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST ASIA AND PACIFIC AREAS

results.snippet: Under renewed pressure at the United Nations to accept at least a short extension of his term when it expires Dec. 31, Secretary General Thant warned that time was running short for his job to be filled and urged prompt action on a successor.
results.lead_paragraph: Under renewed pressure at the United Nations to accept at least a short extension of his term when it expires Dec. 31, Secretary General Thant warned that time was running short for his job to be filled and urged prompt action on a successor.

results.abstract: A Szent-Gyorgyi, discussing current crisis of science and mankind, contends science is product of human curiosity and to stop its development would not be fair to posterity while solution is not to separate science and pol; holds current crisis of mankind results from too rapid development of science that did not leave enough time for mankind to adjust; contends that scientists have responsibility to arrest use of science as instrument of pol rivalry and warfare

headline.main: Science and Government Are Inseparable; " If everything were taken away that science created we would have to die."

results.snippet: WOODS HOLE, Mass. -- The crisis of science (funding, directing and using it for destroying life instead of elevating and protecting it) is part of a wider crisis and can be understood only within its wider context. The history of man consists of two...
results.lead_paragraph: WOODS HOLE, Mass. -- The crisis of science (funding, directing and using it for destroying life instead of elevating and protecting it) is part of a wider crisis and can be understood only within its wider context. The history of man consists of two periods: the prescientific and scientific. What characterized the first was an autistic thinking, by which man made himself the center of the universe, created for his pleasure and temptation.
